title: Mushroom Identification
description: Identify types of mushrooms from descriptions

questions.question: Which prized edible mushroom has a distinctive honeycomb-like cap, grows in spring, and is highly sought after by foragers across North America and Europe?
Which iconic red mushroom with white spots is commonly depicted in fairy tales and is toxic if consumed?
Which mushroom grows on birch trees, resembles a chunk of burnt charcoal, and has been used in traditional medicine for centuries?
Which edible mushroom has a golden to yellow color, a fruity aroma, and a funnel-shaped cap with ridges instead of true gills?
Which large, bracket-shaped mushroom grows on oak trees, has bright orange and yellow bands, and tastes similar to chicken when cooked?
Which extremely deadly mushroom has a greenish-yellow cap, white gills, and is responsible for the majority of mushroom poisoning deaths worldwide?
Which white, shaggy mushroom is commonly found on lawns, has a cylindrical cap that turns inky black as it matures, and is also called the 'lawyer's wig'?
Which mushroom grows underground near tree roots, has an intense earthy aroma, and is one of the most expensive foods in the world by weight?
Which white, globe-shaped mushroom can grow to the size of a soccer ball and is edible when the interior flesh is still pure white?
Which popular edible mushroom grows in shelf-like clusters on dead or dying trees and has a soft, fan-shaped cap that can be white, gray, or brown?
Which white, cascading mushroom resembles a mane of icicles hanging from a tree and is studied for its potential brain-health benefits?
Which mushroom has a dark, glossy, kidney-shaped cap with a lacquered appearance and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for over 2,000 years?
Which thin, long-stemmed mushroom grows in tight clusters, has tiny white caps, and is commonly used in Asian soups and salads?
Which large, feathery mushroom grows at the base of oak trees in autumn, is also called 'hen of the woods,' and is prized in Japanese cuisine?
Which colorful bracket fungus displays concentric zones of brown, tan, and green on fallen logs and is one of the most researched medicinal mushrooms?
